db:abstract.db:para: Provides a xdg_surface that offers desktop-style compositor-specific features to a surface.

db:para.db:emphasis: This type is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.

db:abstract.db:para: This type was introduced in Qt 5.8.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This type is part of the XdgShellV5 extension and provides a way to extend the functionality of an existing WaylandSurface with features specific to desktop-style compositors, such as resizing and moving the surface.
It corresponds to the Wayland interface xdg_surface for the unstable xdg-shell protocol v5.

db:section.db:title: parentSurface : XdgSurfaceV5
db:section.db:para: This property holds the XdgSurfaceV5 parent of this XdgSurfaceV5. When a parent surface is set, the parentSurfaceChanged() signal is guaranteed to be emitted before setTopLevel() and setTransient().

db:section.db:title: shell : XdgShellV5
db:section.db:para: This property holds the shell associated with this XdgSurfaceV5.

db:section.db:title: surface : WaylandSurface
db:section.db:para: This property holds the surface associated with this XdgSurfaceV5.

db:section.db:title: title : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the title of the XdgSurfaceV5.

db:section.db:title: windowType : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the window type of the XdgSurfaceV5.

db:section.db:title: void ackConfigure(int serial)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client has received configure events up to and including the configure event with serial serial and will draw its surface accordingly in the next committed buffer.

db:section.db:title: void setFullscreen(WaylandOutput output)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client wants the xdg_surface to be in full screen mode. The client may specify an output it wishes the xdg_surface to be shown on.

db:section.db:title: void setMaximized()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client wants the xdg_surface to be maximized.

db:section.db:title: void setMinimized()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client wants the xdg_surface to be minimized.

db:section.db:title: setTopLevel()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the parent surface is unset, effectively making the window top level.

db:section.db:title: setTransient()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the parent surface is set, effectively making the window transient.

db:section.db:title: void showWindowMenu(WaylandSeat seat, point localSurfacePosition)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client wants to show a context menu at localSurfacePosition, using the Wayland seat seat. It's typically emitted in response to the user right-clicking the window decorations.

db:section.db:title: void startMove(WaylandSeat seat)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client wants to start an interactive move of the XdgSurfaceV5, typically in response to the window decorations being dragged by seat.

db:section.db:title: void startResize(WaylandSeat seat, enumeration edges)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client wants to start an interactive resize of the XdgSurfaceV5, typically in response to the window decorations being dragged by seat on the window borders given by edges.

db:section.db:title: void unsetFullscreen()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client doesn't want the xdg_surface to be in full screen mode anymore.

db:section.db:title: void unsetMaximized()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the client doesn't want the xdg_surface to be maximized anymore.

db:section.db:title: void initialize(XdgShellV5 xdgShell, WaylandSurface surface, WaylandResource resource)
db:section.db:para: Initializes the XdgSurfaceV5, associating it with the given xdgShell, surface, and resource.

db:section.db:title: void sendClose()
db:section.db:para: Sends a close event to the client.

db:section.db:title: int sendConfigure(size size, list<uint> states)
db:section.db:para: Sends a configure event to the client. size contains the pixel size of the surface. Known states are enumerated in XdgSurfaceV5::State.
